elements.title: candle salad
elements.contents: ... that a candle salad (example pictured) was once described as "probably the only arts and crafts project on TV to ever run the risk of being blurred out by the network censors"?

elements.title: the video-game adaptation of Little Nicky
elements.contents: ... that the video-game adaptation of Little Nicky allows the player to print their results using the Game Boy Printer?

elements.title: Siege of Auximus
elements.contents: ... that during the Siege of Auximus, a bodyguard saved Belisarius's life by blocking an arrow with his hand?

elements.title: Lamarr Wilson
elements.contents: ... that Lamarr Wilson was known for his unorthodox reviews, once testing a "spill-proof" mug by hitting it with a baseball bat?

elements.title: Dizzy
elements.contents: ... that Cathy Cassidy wrote her debut novel Dizzy in three months?

elements.title: Master of the Cité des dames
elements.contents: ... that the Master of the Cité des dames workshop made illustrations for the works of Christine de Pizan that would serve as models for other illustrators?

elements.title: Phone Home
elements.contents: ... that the Legends of Tomorrow episode "Phone Home" was inspired by the film E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial?

elements.title: Demodex injai
elements.contents: ... that submerging a dog in motor oil was a pseudoscientific method used to treat infestations of Demodex injai?

elements.title: Pentecostal Churches of the Apostolic Faith
elements.contents: ... that a splinter denomination of the Pentecostal Churches of the Apostolic Faith taught that all humans pre-existed in Adam's "seed"?
